summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 2020 discussing a request for assistance with a 'taint review' related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The request originates from the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad and seeks personnel to help review potentially privileged material.

connections.description: Implied professional relationship within the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad, where SA is the case agent and C is a supervisory special agent (SSA) to be copied on requests.

events.title: FBI Request for Taint Review Assistance
events.description: The FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad requests personnel to assist with a taint review for the Jeffrey Epstein case, describing it as a 'unique opportunity' on a 'high profile investigation'.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking assistance for a 'taint review' in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of June 2020, indicating ongoing investigative work.
The request originated from the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force (Squad C-2).
The document refers to the Epstein investigation as a 'high profile investigation' and a 'unique opportunity' for personnel.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and resource allocation for the case.
